intro: Nototriche pulvinata, commonly known as the golden cup-mud, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves with a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a compact, cup-shaped inflorescence. Nototriche pulvinata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
